title: Strictly pays homage to Toy Story and Incredibles with stunning Disney opening
text:
Strictly goes Disney for its opening number (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing kicked off Movie Week in style with an incredible routine which paid homage to Disney Pixar classics.

Kicking off with professional dancer Anton Du Beke as Mr Incredible, the first segment took viewers on a punchy, jazz routine inspired by Brad Bird’s 2004 classic.

The geared switched for balloons and slow dances to channel Up, with animated characters from the film even invading the screen between.

Lastly, introduced by Buzz Lightyear and Woody, was Toy Story – where the dancers dressed up as Bo Peep and the green bucket soldiers in a dance to Randy Newman’s You’ve Got A Friend In Me.

This year’s Movie Week features even more Disney too, with Neil Jones and Alex Scott performing to a track from Moana.

The Incredibles are real everyone (Picture: BBC)

Up was also channeled on the show (Picture: BBC)

Other routines on the night included Will Bayley going all out to the Pokemon theme, while Michelle Visage channelled Liza Minnelli for a Cabaret-inspired routine.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Safe to say, people were bowled over by the Disney routine.

That was my heaven #Strictly — Lucas Michael (@_LucasMichael_) October 5, 2019

That was the cutest opening number 😭 #Strictly — amy (@amzdancexx) October 5, 2019

This opening is everything 😍 #Strictly — Jade (@xjade_xo) October 5, 2019

Incredible, indeed.

It was a pretty memorable night elsewhere, between Katya Jones falling mid routine and Craig Revel Horwood’s ‘fake teeth’ gaffe.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Sunday at 7.15pm on BBC One.

description: Strictly Come Dancing channels Disney in an incredible opening routine for Disney.
